ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Baseline: Study Cycle the trial was drawn from.
Baseline: Study Block the trial was drawn from.
Baseline: Type of stimulus.
Baseline: Which unique stimulus was presented?
Baseline: What the participant typed in, as a response to image description.
Notes: For objects, x= smaller; z = bigger; For scenes, x = outdoor; z = indoor

ElementDescription: Baseline: How much time elapsed between the stimulus appearing on the screen and the participant pressing a response button.
Apeture: Study Cycle the trial was drawn from.
Apeture: Study Block the trial was drawn from.
Apeture: Type of stimulus.
Apeture: Which unique stimulus was presented?
Was the full stimulus that corresponds to the aperture seen in the baseline study phase?
Notes: 0= No, new (it was not seen); 2= Yes (old, it was seen)

ElementDescription: What the participant typed in, as a response to whether they thought the aperture came from an old (studied) or new (unstudied) item.
Was the participant's response correct?
How much time elapsed between the aperture appearing and the participant responding 1 or 2?
What the participant typed in as the name of the item or scene (either recalled or guessed).
Time on the computer clock when the 'recall phase' started (i.e. the participant was able to type in letters).
Time elapsed between recall onset and the point when the participant typed in the first letter
Time elapsed between recall onset and the point when the participant finished typing and hit enter
Whether the participant's "recall" response was scored as correct.
